IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SPREAD A PASSION FOR SUPREMACY OF GOD IN ALL THINGS FOR THE JOY OF ALL PEOPLES THROUGH JESUS CHRIST
IRS990.MissionDesc: AS A CHRISTIAN HEDONISM PUBLISHING PLATFORM, PERSUADED BY THE INDISPENSABLE BIBLICAL REALITY THAT GOD IS MOST GLORIFIED IN US WHEN WE ARE MOST SATISFIED IN HIM, WE EXIST - TO MOVE PEOPLE TO LIVE FOR THE GLORY OF GOD, - BY HELPING THEM BE SATISFIED IN GOD ABOVE ALL ELSE, ESPECIALLY IN THEIR SUFFERING, - BY COMMUNICATING THE TRUTH, AND BEAUTY, AND WORTH OF ALL GOD IS FOR US IN CHRIST, - GROUNDED IN, GOVERNED BY, AND SATURATED WITH THE INFALLIBLE CHRISTIAN SCRIPTURES.
IRS990.Desc: SPREADING: DESIRING GOD (DG) DISTRIBUTES OUR TEACHING RESOURCES THROUGH EVENTS, PARTNERSHIPS AND DIGITAL PROMOTION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: TEACHING: DESIRING GOD CREATES NEW TEACHING RESOURCES SUCH AS ARTICLES, BOOKS, PODCASTS AND VIDEOS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PRODUCT: DESIRING GOD MAINTAINS AN INDEPENDENT WEB PLATFORM WHERE ALL OF OUR TEACHING RESOURCES ARE HOSTED.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: MINISTRY PARTNERS:DG MINISTERS TO OUR DONOR PARTNERS THROUGH 1:1 PRAYER, TEACHING RESOURCES, VIDEO PRODUCTION, AND EVENTS.

USAddress.AddressLine1Txt: 2020 HOWELL MILL RD NW STE D-335

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) AND IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A)(2) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. AS SUCH, IT IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES ON NET UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. THE ORGANIZATION HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS FOR UNCERTAINTY AND HAS NOT RECOGNIZED A LIABILITY RELATED TO TAX MATTERS NOR IDENTIFIED UNRECOGNIZED TAX MATTERS THAT ARE REQUIRED TO BE DISCLOSED.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC - AUSTRALIA, BRUNEI, BURMA, CAMBODIA,
EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND & GREENLAND) - ALBANIA, ANDORRA, AUSTRIA, BELGIUM
NORTH AMERICA - CANADA AND MEXICO, BUT NOT THE UNITED STATES
SOUTH ASIA - AFGHANISTAN, BANGLADESH, BHUTAN, INDIA, MALDIVES, NEPAL,
SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA - ANGOLA, BENIN, BOTSWANA, BURKINA FASO,
MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA - ALGERIA, BAHRAIN, DJIBOUTI, EGYPT,
RUSSIA AND NEIGHBORING STATES - ARMENIA, AZERBIJAN, BELARUS,
SOUTH AMERICA - ARGENTINA, BOLIVIA, BRAZIL, CHILE, COLUMBIA, ECUADOR,

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE DEMONSTRATED DEPENDABILITY IN USING THE FUNDS FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE.
GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO ORGANIZATIONS OR INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE DEMONSTRATED DEPENDABILITY IN USING THE FUNDS FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE.
JOHN PIPER RECEIVED A HOUSING ALLOWANCE OF $20,000 IN THE CURRENT YEAR FOR PERSONAL USE. THIS ALLOWANCE IS NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE INCOME.
STOCK DONATIONS ARE SOLD BY STIFEL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DESIRING GOD MINISTRIES DOES NOT HAVE ANY COMMITTEES WITH AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT AND COMPLIANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS A DRAFT OF THE 990 AND SENDS IT TO THE BOARD WITH RECOMMENDATION OF APPROVAL. THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES BEFORE THE 990 IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS BOARD MEMBERS, PAID STAFF, AND VOLUNTEERS. BOARD MEMBERS WHO HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST SHOULD NOT PARTICIPATE OR VOTE OR BE INVOLVED IN THE DECISION MAKING PROCESS IN MATTERS RELATING TO THE CONFLICT. BOARD MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO SIGN AN AGREEMENT TO ABIDE BY THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. BOARD MEMBERS ABSAIN FROM DISCUSSION AND VOTING ON ANY MATTERS OR TRANSACTIONS THAT HAVE AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD WILL SET ALL ADJUSTMENTS FOR EXECUTIVE-LEVEL SALARIES. A COMPENSATION TASK FORCE (CTF) OF BOARD MEMBERS WAS FORMED TO DETERMINE SALARY RANGES FOR ALL STAFF POSITIONS. THE CTF CONSULTED WITH AN INDEPENDENT FIRM TO DO A COMPARATIVE SALARY REVIEW AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS. SALARIES SET BY THE BOARD ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MEETING MINUTES. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST COMPLETED IN 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE ON ITS WEBSITE AND UPON REQUEST, WHILE ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

OTHER PROFESSIONAL FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 684. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 16,498. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 19. TOTAL EXPENSES 17,201. OTHER CONTRACT SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 1,953,277. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 323,839. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 18,326. TOTAL EXPENSES 2,295,442.
